content: Morning Rohan. Just checking in - did the soreness from Friday's Phase 2 session ease up a bit?
Morning Ruby. Still a bit tight in the legs but moving fine. Nothing unmanageable.
Hey Rohan - your Oura data shows the muscle soreness is reflected as a 7 bpm higher resting HR and a 15% dip in HRV. Your body's flagging muscle repair as a stressor. Prioritise sleep tonight.
Got it. Will make sure I wind down early tonight. Thanks Advik.
Carla - my usual protein bar spiked glucose moderately on my CGM. Is that okay?
Good spot üëç Let's A/B test this. Tomorrow, try a handful of almonds + 1 apple instead of the bar. We'll compare glucose curve & your energy 90 min later.
Makes sense. I'll do that tomorrow afternoon.
Reminder - Carla's call with Javier is tomorrow at 3pm. She'll cover the food swaps for Nutrition v2.0.
Rachel - my Jakarta schedule's packed. I can only fit 2 strength sessions this week, not 3.
No problem. I'll send you a consolidated full-body workout combining the key moves into 1 efficient routine.
Perfect. That'll help me stick to the plan.
Video link sent to you & Javier for Carla's 3pm call. Ready when you are.
Call went well. Javier's on board with quinoa swap, more lentil-based dishes, and upping avocado use for healthy fats.
Great. He said he'd try a quinoa pilaf tomorrow.
Carla, just read about the 'food matrix' How does that apply to almond/apple vs processed bar? Is it more than just macros?
Exactly - whole foods have intact fiber, water, and micronutrients, changing digestion speed & satiety. The matrix affects how your body handles the nutrients vs. isolated, processed forms.
Morning, how was HRV after the almond/apple snack test yesterday?
Curve was smoother. Felt steadier energy-wise too.
Confirmed. The glucose spike was 32% lower than with the protein bar. That's a win for ApoB control too.
Interesting. Will stick with this swap for now.
Pre-travel reminder - Advik's scheduled active recovery days for tomorrow & Wed to preload before your Jakarta flight.
Got it. I'll block those out.
Active recovery this morning and light mobility & 20min walk. Helps keep HRV stable during travel.
On it now.
Safe flight tonight. Let me know if you need anything coordinated in Jakarta.
Thanks Rubyüôè Should be fine - thanks for confirming the hotel gym.
Morning from SG. How's Jakarta? (UTC+7 now)
Morning. Landed late but slept ok. Starting with the condensed workout Rachel sent.
Nice - send me quick feedback after today so I can tweak for Saturday's session.
Felt solid. Managed all sets without rushing.
Quick note‚Äîhotel buffet tip: build plate with eggs + leafy greens + avocado for steady energy.
Done. Skipped the pastries this time.
Travel check - sleep score's dipped a bit. Worth aiming for 30min earlier bedtime tonight.
Will do. Early start tomorrow too.
HRV holding steady despite travel üëç Active recovery today + hydration will keep it that way.
Understood. Adding electrolyte mix to my water.
Back in SG tomorrow. Want me to slot a light session Monday before work?
Yes, that'll help me reset post-trip.
Just flagging - this week's adjustments kept all KPIs on track. We'll review Monday and see if we can push recovery scores higher next week.
Sounds good. Appreciate the whole team's help this week.
